formattedAddress: 14 Stuyvesant Oval #10B, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 14 Stuyvesant Oval #10B, New York, NY 10009, USA

originalText.text:
I love this belt because it takes pressure off my lumbar spine and relieves my back pain.

As a NY State Licensed Massage Therapist, I've worked at the US Open Tennis tournament and massaged the world’s top players and couldn’t imagine working the long and demanding hours without this belt! Even after 10 massages in a day, my back felt great!!

I discovered this belt also helped me during the second & third trimester of my pregnancy when I needed a solution to my SI joint feeling unstable. After I started wearing this belt, my back felt much better and helped me to be active again the entire pregnancy.

I tried so many belts, and this one is the best!!! Don’t waste your money to buy other belts. This is it!!! Thank you, Dr. Safko!

originalText.text:
I didn't expect the sudden onset of lower back pain at 31 years old. However, once I started to work from home I found myself sitting at my desk for 10 hours a day which compounded with my propensity to sleep on my stomach. After a few months my back was in shambles and I wasn't able to play golf or fall asleep regularly.

That's when I reached out to Dr. Safko and started using the X-Factor belt. It's been a complete life changer and provides me with a means to sleep on my back while keeping everything in line and supported. On the golf course it's supportive pressure on my hips allows me to swing my hardest without worrying about the lower back pain I was accustomed to feeling after the round.

I can't recommend this belt enough.

Sean Morgan
San Jose, CA

originalText.text: I spent the better part of the last decade playing Collegiate, Professional and International Rugby around the World culminating with playing for the US National Team in the 2015 Rugby World Cup in London, England. Luckily, maybe miraculously, I made it through this largely injury free. It wasn’t until I joined the “Real World,” and found myself sitting at a desk for 10+ hours a day that I experienced my first major injury. Even though my lifestyle and occupation changed in a major way, I was slow to adjust how I trained and it didn’t take long for reality to set in the form of debilitating lower back pain. I went to Dr. Safko ahead of an upcoming ski trip to Montana looking for a miracle - and the X-factor Belt was that miracle. Along with a few appointments to relieve the back pain, the X-Factor Belt provided me the stability and confidence to ski as if I was 100%. It stayed secure through all the bumps and turns that come with 4 aggressive days of skiing and never caused me any discomfort. The X-Factor Belt is comfortable, durable, and most importantly for me, a key tool for maintaining an active lifestyle.

originalText.text:
I’m a 30-year-old active male, 5’11 165 lbs. I run 25-30 miles a week and also play pickup basketball twice a week. I have had lower back pain for a few years now from a sedentary job, as well as lack of stretching. I was introduced to Dr. Safko through a childhood friend who showed me the X-Factor Belt. It has been terrific for my long runs and I even hoop with it on! It allows me to focus on my core during athletic movements and not put that extra pressure on my lower back, all while giving me the confidence to play completely pain free.

Dan Fortuna

New York, NY

originalText.text:
Before seeing Dr. Safko, I had never been to a chiropractor before. Boy was it life changing -- but the X-Factor Belt was the real game changer. I had injured my lower back squatting and could barely walk. The belt brought stability to both my life and my back, and allowed me to keep moving while injured and finally lead me back to being pain free. It is extremely comfortable, easy to use, and effective - keeping your back intact, while also limiting movement, and therefore pain.

The best part of the belt is it is not a one trick pony. During COVID-19 I was forced to work from my couch and my workouts and mobility became limited for a number of months. After two weeks, my posture was suffering and it was hard for me to continue to work and exercise without pain. I immediately went back to the belt, and I am happy to report I am no longer in pain. Not only does the belt work, but you can also wear it under or over clothes to either hide your pain or make a fashion statement.

God Bless The X-Factor Belt!

Stephen Santangelo
Miami, FL
